stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.

stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.

preGame:
Step right up, sports fans, and welcome to the most wonderful time of the year! No, I‚Äôm not talking about the Feast of the Harvest, I‚Äôm talking about the Playoffs! üèÜ We are live at 'The Unruly Yard' in New Monteforte for Game 1 of the Losers Bracket, where the stakes are higher than a Warlock‚Äôs ego! The atmosphere here is absolutely electric‚Äîand I don‚Äôt just mean the literal sparks coming off the unstable scaffolding. The graffiti is fresh, the crowd is already throwing bricks, and the smell of impending violence is sweeter than a corrupted soul! üòà

Our visitors today, the Wyrmwood Stronghammers, have emerged from the mines looking for blood! I saw their healer, Hamburger Marthe, preparing for the match by seeing how many dried beans he could fit in his nostril. üëÉ That‚Äôs the kind of dedication to personal excellence we love to see in Trollball! Meanwhile, their heavy hitter Sabian Gleason was seen counting clouds in the sky. It‚Äôs a peaceful hobby for a man who plans to turn his opponents into a fine red mist with a maul! ‚òÅÔ∏è

But don't count out the home-town favorites, the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures! They‚Äôve got the home-field advantage here in the mud and the chaos. Placido Kora was seen telling a series of terrible jokes to the Trollball itself to 'loosen it up'‚Äîwhich is frankly more terrifying than any curse I‚Äôve ever seen! ‚öΩ And look at Wolbrom Ariella over there, singing a sea shanty so out of tune it‚Äôs practically a war crime. If the Stronghammers don't kill them, the singing might! üé∂

This is a Best of 3 series, folks, and neither of these teams wants to slip further down the bracket. While I‚Äôll always have my heart with the Ebon Gate Corruptors‚Äîand a healthy disdain for those sparkly bores in the Haven Lights‚ÄîI have to admit, there‚Äôs nothing like the smell of a stadium riot to get the morning started! Let‚Äôs get to the action! üí•
postGame:
Great Greasy Golems, what a display of sheer, unadulterated carnage! üòµ If you like your sports with a side of internal bleeding, then New Monteforte was the place to be tonight! The Chaos Creatures defended their home turf with a 3-0 victory over the Stronghammers, but the score doesn't even begin to tell the story of the broken bones and bruised egos left on the field! üèüÔ∏è

The action started with a bang when Raouf Dragone snatched up the Trollball, only to be immediately introduced to the business end of Sabian Gleason‚Äôs maul! Sabian absolutely leveled the poor devil, sending him straight to the infirmary before the game could even get warm! üî® It was a beautiful, crunchy tackle that reminded me why I love this game more than a stack of unpaid bar tabs! 

The Wyrmwood boys weren't finished there, oh no! Godart Urissa decided Gabriele Klehm‚Äôs face was looking a bit too symmetrical and proceeded to fix that with a devastating tackle. Gabriele was out for the count, proving that even at 'The Unruly Yard,' the visitors aren't afraid to make a mess! ü•ä It's enough to make a demon weep with joy, seeing such beautiful aggression right out of the gate!

But the Chaos Creatures aren't just here to look pretty in their graffiti-covered jerseys! Alben Diantha showed us all how it‚Äôs done, weaving through the defense like a rogue fleeing a debt collector and dunking that leather head right into the goal! üèÄ That first point sent the crowd into such a frenzy I think I saw a street performer get thrown into a mine shaft! 1-0 for the home team, and the blood was just starting to flow!

The Stronghammers tried to rally, but the Chaos Creatures‚Äô defense was as stubborn as a White Raven refusing to admit they‚Äôre wrong! Raouf Dragone, back from the brink, got some sweet revenge by absolutely clobbering Calvinna Isador. It was a textbook hit that left Calvinna seeing more stars than a drunk astrologer! ‚≠ê The violence was truly the star of the show today, just the way we like it!

By the time Halftime rolled around, the field looked more like a butcher's shop than a stadium. But thanks to the wonders of the Everwar, everyone popped back up with a fresh face and a convenient lack of memory regarding their previous skull fractures! üîÑ It‚Äôs a wonderful system, really. It allows for twice the violence with none of the permanent paperwork! 

In the second half, things got even weirder! Cornela Piscatelli was out there handing out injuries like they were participation trophies, taking Alben Diantha out of the play with a sickening thud! ü¶¥ Not to be outdone, Sondra Elaina from Wyrmwood decided Boulanger Procto needed a long nap and delivered a tackle that would have made Sir Garon Ironrock proud‚Äîif he wasn't too busy staring at a door somewhere! üö™

The highlight of the evening, however, had to be Ultun Barthelemy! This man went on a absolute rampage, delivering a double-header of destruction! He injured Wolbrom Ariella and Tucker Hett in back-to-back plays! üí• Two knockouts for the price of one! If I had a hat, I'd throw it onto the field, but I don't want to lose it to the rowdy crowd‚Äîthey‚Äôve already stolen three microphones and a healer‚Äôs arming sword!

Despite the Stronghammers' best efforts to turn the game into a wrestling match, Gabriele Klehm delivered the final blow. From deep in the Away Field, Gabriele took a shot that sailed through the goal for two massive points! üéØ It was a display of skill that felt almost out of place amidst all the beautiful stabbing and punching. That brought the final tally to 3-0 for the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures!

So, Game 1 goes to the home team! The Wyrmwood Stronghammers have their work cut out for them if they want to stay in this series. They need to spend less time counting clouds and more time counting their teeth! ü¶∑ We‚Äôll be back for Game 2, and you can bet your last copper it‚Äôs going to be even bloodier! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the muddiest, rowdiest yard in Osterra! Stay brutal, fans! üòàüèí
